conclusion: Analyzing the rotating rods and ring system to understand the capacitor charging process.
Given parameters: Ring radius, rod length, rod resistance, angular velocity, magnetic field.
Calculate the area swept by one rod in time dt: dA = (r²/2) × dθ.
Calculate the rate of change of flux: dΦ/dt = B₁ × (r²/2) × ω.
Calculate the average EMF induced in the rotating system: ε = (1/2) × B₁ × (r²/2) × ω.
Substitute values to find ε = 6 V.
Given capacitance: C = 0.09 F.
Calculate the energy stored in the capacitor: U_capacitor = (1/2) × C × V².
Substitute values to find U_capacitor = 1.62 J.
When the switch is moved to terminal 2, the capacitor discharges through rod ab.
Calculate the force on the rod due to the magnetic field: F = I × L × B₂.
Given parameters: Mass of rod ab and frame, total mass of abcd, height risen.
Calculate the potential energy gained by the frame: U_potential = 2m × g × h.
Substitute values to find U_potential = 0.0392 J.
Energy from the capacitor is converted to kinetic energy, potential energy, and heat loss.
Calculate the back EMF generated by the rod: E = B₂ × l₁ × v.
Calculate the work done by the Lorentz force: W = I × l₁ × B₂ × l₂.
Calculate the charge that flows: Q = I × (l₂/v).
Relate energy conservation to find Q: (1/2) × C × V² = Q × B₂ × l₁ × v.
Calculate the charge on the capacitor: Q = C × V.
Substitute values to find Q = 0.54 C.
Determine the polarity of the plates using the right-hand rule.
